description: Change of use of a single family dwellinghouse into large House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) comprising eight bedrooms (Use Class Sui Generis) with maximum no more than 10 persons and provision of associated cycle storage (Retrospective)
decision_conditions: The proposed HMO shall be implemented as per the details on the approved plans. These works shall be completed to the Council's satisfaction within [six months] of the date of this permission, otherwise planning permission will lapse.
Reason: To remedy the existing situation and to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Pre-existing GF Plan PL/A627/01, Pre-existing FF Plan PL/A627/02, Pre-existing SF Plan PL/A627/03, Pre-existing Front & Rear Elevations Plan PL/A627/04, Existing GF Plan PL/A627/05, Existing FF Plan PL/A627/06,Existing SF Plan PL/A627/07, Existing Front & Rear Elevations Plan PL/A627/08, Proposed GF & Bike Store Details Revised PL/A627/13, Proposed FF Plan as revised PL/A627/14, Proposed SF Plan as revised PL/A627/15, Section through Loft Floor PL/A627/16

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than ten (10) persons within eight (8) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating communal main entrance/ stairs/ circulation space, kitchen/living/dining/bathrooms from bedrooms shall be enhanced by at least 10dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. Where noise emissions include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level should not exceed NR20 Leq 5mins inside habitable rooms. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), E7.A.7 DM DPD, Standard 30 London Housing SPG (2016) and Policy D14 London Plan. | Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
